newsitem.title: USA: North Carolina corn plantings up from last week.
newsitem.headline: North Carolina corn plantings up from last week.

text.p: Corn plantings across the state were ahead of last week despite abnormally cool weather that slowed the growth of some corn, the state agricultural statistics service said in its weekly crop update.
For the week ending April 27, 80 percent corn was planted, up from 60 percent last week, 75 percent a year ago and the five-year average of 70 percent.
Cotton was nine percent completed versus four percent last week, 13 percent last year and 12 percent on average.
Three percent of soybeans were planted this week, compared to two percent last week, one percent last year and three percent on average.
Pasture was rated 71 percent good to excellent and 24 percent fair.
Soil moisture was rated two percent very short, five percent short, 67 percent adequate and 26 percent surplus.
